intro: Dianthera abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian dianthera, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists alike.
